Sentencas: The Ni/yttria-stabilized-zirconia (YSZ) cermet is the most commonly applied fuel electrode for solid oxide cells (SOCs).
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses

Sentencas: Loss of Ni/YSZ electrode activity is a key life-time limiting factor of the SOC.
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses

Sentencas: Developing means to mitigate this loss of performance or re-activate a fuel electrode is therefore important.
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses

Sentencas: In this work, we report a series of five tests on state-of-the-art Ni/YSZ-YSZ-CGO(barrier)-LSC/CGO cells.
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses

Sentencas: All cells were deliberately degraded via gas stream impurities in CO2/CO or harsh steam electrolysis operation.
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses

Sentencas: The cells were re-activated via a variety of reverse current treatments (RCTs).
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses

Sentencas: Via electrochemical impedance spectroscopy, we found that the Ni/YSZ electrode performance could be recovered via RCT, but not via constant fuel cell operation.
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses

Sentencas: For optimized RCT, we obtained a lower Ni/YSZ electrode resistance than the initial resistance.
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses

Sentencas: E.g. at 700 degrees C we measured fuel electrode resistance of 180 m Omega cm(2), 390 m Omega cm(2), and 159 m Omega cm(2) before degradation, after degradation and after re-activation via RCT, respectively.
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses

Sentencas: Post-test SEM revealed that the RCT led to formation of nano-particles in the fuel electrode.
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses

Sentencas: Besides the remarkable improvement, the results also showed that RCTs can weaken Ni/YSZ interfaces and the electrode/electrolyte interface.
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses

Sentencas: This indicates that finding an optimum RCT profile is crucial for achieving maximum benefit.
Titulo: Re-activation of degraded nickel cermet anodes - Nano-particle formation via reverse current pulses
